<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Item&nbsp;7.01. Regulation FD Disclosure. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Adoption of the New Accounting Standard for Net Periodic Benefit Cost Presentation </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and subsidiaries (collectively, &#147;we,&#148; &#147;our&#148; or &#147;Mondel&#275;z International&#148;) are furnishing
this current report to provide supplemental financial information related to the retrospective impact of presenting net periodic benefit cost in accordance with revised guidance issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;).
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">As previously disclosed in our Annual Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2017, in
March 2017, the FASB issued an Accounting Standards Update (&#147;ASU&#148;) to improve the presentation of net periodic pension and postretirement benefit costs. The standard requires employers to disaggregate the service cost component from the
other components of net benefit cost and disclose the amount and location where the net benefit cost is recorded in the income statement or capitalized in assets. The standard is to be applied on a retrospective basis for the change in presentation
in the income statement and prospectively for the change in presentation on the balance sheet. The ASU is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017, with early adoption permitted. We adopted the standard on January&nbsp;1,
2018. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">As a result of this adoption, we have disaggregated the components of our net periodic pension and postretirement benefit costs and moved
components other than service costs to a new line item, <I>benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> (income)/expense</I>, located below operating income. Therefore, this change has resulted in revisions of our financial
results for reported gross profit, operating income and segment operating income as well as for our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial results for Adjusted Gross Profit, Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment
Operating income. The changes described above will have no impact on our previously reported consolidated net revenues, net earnings or earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;), nor on our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial
results for Organic Net Revenue and Adjusted EPS, for any period. These changes also do not amend or modify any disclosure contained in, or reflect events occurring subsequent to the filing of, our Annual Report on Form <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2017. See the chart below and Exhibit 99.1 for the revised unaudited GAAP and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial information for all quarters
of 2017 and 2016 and for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2017, 2016 and 2015. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Revised Amounts Reflecting Reclassification of Benefit Plan Components </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(in millions of U.S. dollars) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">%&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Financial Measures </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We use <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial information and believe it is useful to investors as it provides additional information to
facilitate comparisons of historical operating results, identify trends in our underlying operating results, and provide additional insight and transparency on how we evaluate our business. We use <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
financial measures to budget, make operating and strategic decisions and evaluate our performance. We have detailed the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> adjustments that we make in our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
definitions below. The adjustments generally fall within the following categories: acquisition&nbsp;&amp; divestiture activities, gains and losses on intangible asset sales and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairments, major
program restructuring activities, constant currency and related adjustments, major program financing and hedging activities and other major items affecting comparability of operating results. We believe the
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures should always be considered along with the related U.S. GAAP financial measures. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The definitions of our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures did not change as a
result of the adoption of this ASU. For all periods presented in this Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">8-K,</FONT> our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measure Adjusted Operating Income is defined below and can also be
found within our historically reported Annual Reports on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> and Quarterly Reports on <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Form&nbsp;10-Q</FONT> for periods presented. We have also supplementally provided
below the definitions of Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted Segment Operating Income on a comparable basis. As new events or circumstances arise, these definitions could change over time. When these definitions change, we provide the updated
definitions and present the related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> historical results on a comparable basis <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Adjusted Gross Profit</I> &#150; defined as gross profit excluding the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP>; the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP>; acquisition integration costs; incremental costs associated with the Jacobs Douwe Egberts
(&#147;JDE&#148;) coffee business transactions; the operating results of divestitures <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP>; the historical coffee business operating results
<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP>; the historical Venezuelan operating results; <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency
transaction derivative contracts <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(6)</SUP>; and incremental expenses related to the malware incident. We also present &#147;Adjusted Gross Profit margin,&#148; which is subject to the same adjustments
as Adjusted Gross Profit. We believe that Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted Gross Profit margin provide improved comparability of underlying operating results. We also evaluate growth in Adjusted Gross Profit on a constant currency basis <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(4)</SUP>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income</I> &#150; defined
as operating income (or segment operating income) excluding the impacts of the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP>; the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program
<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP>; Venezuela remeasurement and deconsolidation losses and historical operating results; gains or losses (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairment charges) on
goodwill and intangible assets; divestiture <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;or acquisition gains or losses and related divestiture, acquisition and integration costs; the JDE coffee business transactions <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"></SUP>&nbsp;gain and net incremental costs; the operating results of divestitures <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP>; our
historical global coffee business operating results <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP>; <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted
currency transaction derivative contracts <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(6)</SUP>; equity method investment earnings historically reported within operating income <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(7)</SUP>; benefits
from the resolution of tax matters <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(8)</SUP>; CEO transition remuneration <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(9)</SUP>; and incremental expenses related to the malware incident. We also
present &#147;Adjusted Operating Income margin&#148; and &#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin,&#148; which are subject to the same adjustments as Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income. We believe that Adjusted
Operating Income, Adjusted Segment Operating Income, Adjusted Operating Income margin and Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin provide improved comparability of underlying operating results. We also evaluate growth in Adjusted Operating Income
and Adjusted Segment Operating Income on a constant currency basis <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(4)</SUP>. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(1)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">When items no longer impact our current or future presentation of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> operating results, we remove these items from our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
definitions. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(2)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Divestitures include completed sales of businesses and exits of major product lines upon completion of a sale or licensing agreement. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(3)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">We continue to have an ongoing interest in the legacy coffee business we deconsolidated in 2015 as part of the JDE coffee business transactions. For historical periods prior to the July&nbsp;15, 2015 coffee business
deconsolidation, we have reclassified any net revenue or operating income from the historical coffee business and included them where the coffee equity method investment earnings are presented within Adjusted EPS. As such, Organic Net Revenue,
Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted Operating Income in all periods do not include the results of our legacy coffee businesses which are shown within Adjusted EPS only. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(4)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Constant currency operating results are calculated by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the current-period local currency operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate the financial
statements in the comparable prior-year period to determine what the current-period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the currency exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior-year period. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(5)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> adjustments related to the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program reflect costs incurred that relate to the objectives of our program to transform our supply chain network and
organizational structure. Costs that do not meet the program objectives are not reflected in the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> adjustments. Refer to our Annual Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 for more information on the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(6)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">During the third quarter of 2016, we began to exclude unrealized gains and losses <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts) from outstanding commodity and
forecasted currency transaction derivatives from our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures until such time that the related exposures impact our operating results. Since we purchase commodity and forecasted currency
contracts to mitigate price volatility primarily for inventory requirements in future periods, we made this adjustment to remove the volatility of these future inventory purchases on current operating results to facilitate comparisons of our
underlying operating performance across periods. We also discontinued designating commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives for hedge accounting treatment. To facilitate comparisons of our underlying operating results, we have recast
all historical <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures to exclude the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts. </TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">3 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(7)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Historically, we have recorded income from equity method investments within our operating income as these investments operated as extensions of our base business. Beginning in the third quarter of 2015, we began to
record the earnings from our equity method investments in <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax</FONT> equity method investment earnings outside of operating income following the deconsolidation of our coffee business. Refer to Note 1,
<I>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</I>, in our Annual Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 for more information. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(8)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">During 2017, we recorded benefits from the reversal of tax liabilities in connection with the resolution of a Brazilian indirect tax matter and settlement of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-acquisition</FONT>
Cadbury tax matters. Refer to Note 12, <I>Commitments and Contingencies&#151;Tax Matters</I>, in our Annual Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2017 for more information.
</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(9)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">On November&nbsp;20, 2017, Dirk Van de Put succeeded Irene Rosenfeld as CEO of Mondel&#275;z International in advance of her retirement at the end of March 2018. In order to incent Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put to join us, we
provided him compensation with a total combined target value of $42.5&nbsp;million to make him whole for incentive awards he forfeited or grants that were not made to him when he left his former employer. The compensation we granted took the form of
cash, deferred stock units, performance share units and stock options. In connection with Irene Rosenfeld&#146;s retirement, we made her outstanding grants of performance share units for the 2016-2018 and 2017-2019 performance cycles eligible for
continued vesting and approved a $0.5&nbsp;million salary for her service as Chairman from January through March 2018. We refer to these elements of Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put&#146;s and Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s compensation arrangements together as
&#147;CEO transition remuneration.&#148; We are excluding amounts we expense as CEO transition remuneration from our 2017 and future <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results because those amounts are not part of our regular
compensation program and are incremental to amounts we would have incurred as ongoing CEO compensation. As a result, in 2017, we excluded amounts expensed for the cash payment to Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put and partial vesting of his equity grants. In 2018,
we expect to exclude amounts paid for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s service as Chairman and partial vesting of Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put&#146;s and Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s equity grants. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We believe that the presentation of these <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures, when considered together with our U.S. GAAP
financial measures and the reconciliations to the corresponding U.S. GAAP financial measures, helps provide a more complete understanding of the factors and trends affecting our business than could be obtained absent these disclosures. Because <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures vary among companies, the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures presented in this report may not be comparable to similarly titled measures used by other
companies. Our use of these <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures is not meant to be considered in isolation or as a substitute for any U.S. GAAP financial measure. A limitation of the
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures is they do not include all items of income and expense that affect us and have an impact on our U.S. GAAP reported results. The best way to address this limitation is by evaluating
our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures in combination with our U.S. GAAP reported results and carefully evaluating the reconciliations of U.S. GAAP reported figures to the
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Financial Schedules </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Exhibit 99.1 to this Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">8-K</FONT> contains financial schedules that provide the reconciliations for our revised reported
gross profit and operating income and our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures after the accounting change for net periodic pension cost and net periodic postretirement benefit cost for all quarters of 2017 and 2016
and for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2017, 2016 and 2015. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Item&nbsp;9.01. Financial Statements and Exhibits. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) The following exhibit is being furnished with this Current Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">8-K.</FONT> </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 99.1 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>U.S. GAAP to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Reconciliations </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In addition to reporting our U.S. GAAP operating results, we have historically reported <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial information.
Refer also to our Quarterly Reports on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-Q</FONT> and our Annual Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the periods presented for additional information on our GAAP to <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> adjustments. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right">Schedule 1.1 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Revised Amounts Reflecting Reclassification of Benefit Plan Components </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Gross Profit / Operating Income </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(in millions of U.S. dollars) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR STYLE="font-size:1px; ">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right">Schedule 1.4 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Revised Amounts Reflecting Reclassification of Benefit Plan Components </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Gross Profit / Operating Income </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(in millions of U.S. dollars) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="18" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>For the Three Months Ended June 30, 2017</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Net<BR>Revenues</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Gross<BR>Profit</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Gross<BR>Profit<BR>Margin</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right">Schedule 2.1 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Revised Amounts Reflecting Reclassification of Benefit Plan Components </B></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">15.6</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">%&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right">Schedule 2.6 </P>

millions of U.S. dollars) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Reclassification of benefit plan components</P></TD>
